problem_text:
Let M be a one-generated saturated formation, that is, the intersection of all saturated formations containing some fixed finite group. Let F be a subformation of M such that F ̸= FF.
a) Is it true that then F can be written in the form F = F1 · · · Ft, where Fi is a non-decomposable formation for every i = 1, . . . , t?
b) Suppose that F = F1 · · · Ft, where Fi is a non-decomposable formation for every i = 1, . . . , t. Is it true that then all factors Fi are uniquely determined?
A. N. Skiba
